definitions.definition: entice or attempt to entice (someone) to do or acquire something that they find attractive but know to be wrong or not beneficial.
examples: don't allow impatience to tempt you into overexposure and sunburn
synonyms: woo; informalsweet-talk "the manager tried to tempt him to stay"

definitions.definition: have an urge or inclination to do something.
examples: I was tempted to look at my watch, but didn't dare
he was tempted out of retirement to save the team
synonyms: draw "more customers are being tempted by credit"

definitions.definition: risk provoking (a deity or abstract force), usually with undesirable consequences.
